page.title: 10Changes since the 1950's
page.content: There were whists,dances and concerts in the 1950's for entertainment.Alot of work was supplied by boats.Land is much the same as from the 1950's .The electricity came at about 1958.There was a steamer to Lerwick called the Earl of Zetland.People always used to ride ponies alot.There were a few cars around at the time. There were grass tennis courts opposite Millbrae and people played lots of games like foot- ball.A lot of land was owned by the Board of Agriculture in the 1950's . Peat was used widely for fuel.The voe was full of boats.Euchre was an odd game played (a cross bewtween 500 and whist).People used to fish more then. There were some Clydesdale horses used for ploughing.A lot of new council estates have been built recently.Roll-on/Roll-off ferries now link Unst with Yell and the Mainland.
